repnme.cdata!: Bolivia - Land for Agricultural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Land for Agricultural Development
            Project for Bolivia received a moderately satisfactory
            outcome rating with substantial risk to development outcome.
            Both the Bank and the Borrower received moderately
            satisfactory ratings for their performances. There were five
            total restructurings that took place during this project.
            The first restructuring included: (1) modification of land
            credit facility; (2) inclusion of three additional
            mechanisms for land access; and (3) a minor reallocation of
            Credit proceeds. The second restructuring extended the
            closing date by almost two years. The third restructuring
            included a: (1) reformulation of the results matrix; (b)
            establishment of a new disbursement category to make
            explicit the expenditures for consultant services, training
            and operating costs for Component 2; and (3) reallocation of
            Credit proceeds to reflect the evolution of the project. The
            fourth and fifth restructurings extended the closing date by
            six months. There were several lessons taken from this
            project including the following: (1) a pilot project needs
            to incorporate a system to test innovation and make results
            available to policymakers for scaling up; (2) it is possible
            to implement productive investments in ways that are
            compatible with customary land tenure; (3) projects looking
            to expand land access should also consider modalities based
            on usufruct rights; and (4) projects working to improve the
            productive capacity of vulnerable rural populations should
            facilitate insertion into markets.

repnme.cdata!:
Bolivia - Land for Agricultural Development
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Land for
            Agricultural Development Project for Bolivia is to establish
            a decentralized beneficiary-driven land distribution
            mechanism that allows organized landless or poor farmers to
            acquire suitable agricultural lands and implement investment
            subprojects placing them on a sustainable, higher-income,
            livelihood path. The changes consist of: (i) reformulation
            of the project results matrix; (ii) disbursement
            arrangement; and (iii) reallocation of credit proceeds.
